Origins: We don't know how anyone could mistake a photograph of a weather phenomenon (a hurricane) in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Florida with a seismic/oceanic phenomenon (a tsunami) which occurred in the Indian Ocean and struck the coasts of several Asian countries, but here we have it.
Description: Even if we knew nothing else about this photograph, we could eliminate it as a picture of the December 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami, because it has already been circulating for months as a satellite photograph of Hurricane Frances, a storm that struck Florida in September 2004. In fact, the picture is even older than that it's a satellite image of Hurricane Floyd from September 1999.
Example: [Collected on the Internet, 2004] Satellite view of a tsunami (Click photograph to enlarge)
Claim: Photograph shows a satellite view of the Indian Ocean tsunami.
